item.title: 5 Buddhist Tibetan Rites
item.description:
Constant movement in each exercise

Spin with extended arms
Lay down and move your legs upwards while moving chin to chest
Sit down on your knees, arms in hips and stretch forward
Sit down and shift your hips up and forwards
Seal pose to down facing dog
Meditate
item.dc:creator: Nuvhandra

item.title: MIDIFOX
item.description:
find MIDIFOX photos
digitalize schematic from notebook
Code for the Arduino Nano
/* Siegfried Keller * 2017 * * MIDI Controller * This version uses a multiplexer and normal digital inputs are used from 5 to 13 * * Version 3: * 4 analog inputs used as 'page' buttons */ #include <MIDI.h> MIDI_CREATE_DEFAULT_INSTANCE(); //pin number 13 will be an extra button, but it must be connected differently with a resistor //pin 13 is reversed const int ledpin=13; int b = 0; const int v=5;//where the digital pins start, in this case is 5 because control pins take 2,3 and 4 const int numBut=8;//max number 8, digital pins, left one for multiplexer, counting led pin const int numAn=3;//number of potentiometers //const int anf=8; const int numMuxBut=8;//number of button connected to multiplexer const int muxpin=10;//Which pin is connected to the multipexer /*byte nx=144; byte vel=127;*/ byte cc=0; int actualpin; int channel=1; int actual[numBut]; int before[numBut]; int actualAn[numAn]; int beforeAn[numAn]; int actualMux[numMuxBut]; int beforeMux[numMuxBut]; int thre = 800; int val; //multiplexer control pins const int s0 = 2; const int s1 = 3; const int s2 = 4; const int select[] = {s0,s1,s2}; //Adding pages to the analog pins, this buttons(analog) changes the CC note in the 4x4 buttons //by default is on page 1 const int pgOne=48; const int pgTwo=pgOne+18; const int pgThree=pgTwo+18; const int pgFour=pgThree+18; int actualPage; void setup(){ MIDI.begin(); //Serial.begin(9600); Serial.begin(115200); //MIDI.begin(MIDI_CHANNEL_OMNI); //it listen to all incomming message pinMode(ledpin,INPUT); for(int i=0;i<numBut;i++){ actualpin=i+v; pinMode(actualpin,INPUT_PULLUP); before[i]=1; //set 1 as button is not pressed } //set analog inputs as false for(int i=0;i<numAn;i++){ actualAn[i]=0; beforeAn[i]=0; } //setting default page one actualPage=pgOne; //Adding multiplexer //control pins from multiplexer as outputs pinMode(s0,OUTPUT); pinMode(s1,OUTPUT); pinMode(s2,OUTPUT); } void loop(){ //Serial.println(analogRead(0)); if(numBut!=0){updateDigitalBut();} if(numAn!=0){updateAnalog();} if(numMuxBut!=0){updateDigitalMuxBut();} //Ledpin input int ledNote=0; int vi = digitalRead(ledpin); if(actualPage==pgOne){ ledNote=56; }else if(actualPage==pgTwo){ ledNote=74; }else if(actualPage==pgThree){ ledNote=92; }else if(actualPage==pgFour){ ledNote=110; } if(vi==1 && vi!=b){ MIDI.sendNoteOn(ledNote,127,channel); }else if(vi==0 && vi!=b){ MIDI.sendNoteOff(ledNote,127,channel); /*MIDI.sendNoteOff(56,127,channel); MIDI.sendNoteOff(74,127,channel); MIDI.sendNoteOff(92,127,channel); MIDI.sendNoteOff(110,127,channel);*/ } b=vi; //MIDI.read(); } void updateDigitalBut(){ for(int i=0;i<numBut;i++){ actualpin = i+v; actual[i]=digitalRead(actualpin); //reading actual button state //It only sends data if the state has changed /*button is pressed if(actualpin == ledpin){ if((actual[i]==1) && (actual[i]!=before[i])){ //MIDI.sendNoteOn(48+i,127,channel); MIDI.sendNoteOn(actualPage+i,127,channel); }else if((actual[i]==0) && (actual[i]!=before[i])){ //MIDI.sendNoteOff(48+i,127,channel); //MIDI.sendNoteOff(pgOne+i,127,channel); //MIDI.sendNoteOff(pgTwo+i,127,channel); //MIDI.sendNoteOff(pgThree+i,127,channel); //MIDI.sendNoteOff(pgFour+i,127,channel); MIDI.sendNoteOff(actualPage+i,127,channel); } }*/ if(actualpin != muxpin){ if((actual[i]==0) && (actual[i]!=before[i])){ //MIDI.sendNoteOn(48+i,127,channel); MIDI.sendNoteOn(actualPage+i,127,channel); }else if((actual[i]==1) && (actual[i]!=before[i])){ //MIDI.sendNoteOff(48+i,0,channel); MIDI.sendNoteOff(actualPage+i,0,channel); } } before[i]=actual[i];//setting before value as the current because its ending the for } } void updateAnalog(){ for(int i=0;i<numAn;i++){ actualAn[i]=digitalRead(14+i); if((actualAn[i] == HIGH) && (actualAn[i]!=beforeAn[i])){ switch(i){ case 0: actualPage=pgOne; Serial.println("p1"); break; case 1: actualPage=pgTwo; Serial.println("p2"); break; case 2: actualPage=pgThree; Serial.println("p3"); break; case 3: actualPage=pgFour; Serial.println("p4"); break; } //MIDI.sendNoteOn(66+i,127,channel); }else if((actualAn[i] == LOW) && (actualAn[i]!=beforeAn[i])){ //I guess nothing //MIDI.sendNoteOff(66+i,0,channel); } beforeAn[i]=actualAn[i]; } } void updateDigitalMuxBut(){ for(int i=0;i<numMuxBut;i++){//multiplexer actualMux[i]=getValue(i); if((actualMux[i]==0) && (actualMux[i]!=beforeMux[i])){ //MIDI.sendNoteOn(57+i,127,channel); MIDI.sendNoteOn(actualPage+9+i,127,channel); }else if((actualMux[i]==1) && (actualMux[i]!=beforeMux[i])){ //MIDI.sendNoteOff(57+i,0,channel); MIDI.sendNoteOff(actualPage+9+i,0,channel); } beforeMux[i]=actualMux[i]; } } int getValue(int c){ for(int bit=0;bit<3;bit++){ int pin=select[bit]; int bitset = bitRead(c,bit); digitalWrite(pin,bitset); } return digitalRead(muxpin); } Copy

item.title: Protein Farm
item.description:
A semi automated ecosystem farm capable of breeding Tenebrionidae larva.

The mentioned larva can be used for human consumption
item.dc:creator: Nuvhandra

item.title: Solaris Odyssey
item.description:
A platform provides unique, off-grid travel opportunities.
Goal is to provide travelers with a truly self-sustainable, off-grid accommodation and travel experience that minimizes environmental impact while fostering cultural exchange and personal growth. The platform could appeal to eco-conscious, adventurous travelers seeking unique, transformative journeys.

Eco-friendly, solar-powered yurts or tiny homes equipped with organic gardens, water harvesting systems, and renewable energy generators.
Opportunities for guests to learn sustainable living skills like permaculture, composting, and renewable energy.
Partnerships with local communities to provide authentic cultural experiences and support the local economy.
Carbon-neutral transportation options like electric vehicles or hot air balloons.
Curated itineraries and trip planning services focused on immersive, low-impact travel experiences.
item.dc:creator: Nuvhandra

item.title: Acacia
item.description:
Leaves contain flavonoids, terpenoids, and tannins and have abortifacient properties

Stem bark contains 3-(Z)-trans coumaroylbetulin and 3-(E)-cis coumaroylbetulin and has antimalarial properties

Stem bark contains betulinic acid and betulinic acid-3-trans-caffeate and has antimicrobial and antioxidant properties

Leaves contain diterpenes and tannins and have antimicrobial and antioxidant properties

Leaves contain myricetin-3-O-α-l-rhamnoside and quercetin-3-O-α-l-rhamnoside and have antioxidant and cytotoxic properties

Leaves contain β-sitosterol and epigallocatechin and have antilisterial properties
Berlin:
Robinia pseudoacacia


toxalbumin robin
glucoside robinin
Extraction: There are different methods of extraction, such as maceration, percolation, and soxhlet extraction. The choice of method depends on the type of plant material and the desired compound(s) to be extracted. For example, alkaloids can be extracted using acid-base extraction methods.
Fractionation: After extraction, the crude extract can be fractionated to isolate the desired compound(s). Fractionation can be done using various techniques such as chromatography, distillation, and crystallization.
Characterization: Once the compound(s) have been isolated, they can be characterized using various analytical techniques such as spectroscopy and chromatography.
item.dc:creator: Nuvhandra

item.title: Intro
item.description:
Welcome to a journey of exploration, creativity, and self-discovery. This book are my ideas, projects, drawings, thoughts, and learning – a reflection of my multifaceted interests and passions. At its core, this work aims to enrich the reader with knowledge that fosters revolution and independence, enabling a harmonious coexistence with technology and the environment. It is a call to embrace a world without borders, where self-sustaining communities thrive on the free exchange of knowledge, living in harmony with the natural world. As an individual with a deep appreciation for art, music, engineering, technology, sciences, and philosophy, I strive to weave these diverse threads into a cohesive narrative. This book is not merely a collection of words and images; it is a window into my experiences, my life, and my vision for a better world. Through these pages, you will embark on a journey that transcends boundaries, challenging conventional thinking and inspiring a new paradigm of living. We will delve into the realms of art, exploring its power to evoke emotions and provoke thought. We will venture into the depths of science and technology, unraveling their potential to revolutionize our understanding of the world and our place within it. Moreover, this book is a testament to the belief that knowledge should be freely shared, empowering individuals and communities to forge their own paths towards self-sufficiency and harmony with the natural world. It is a call to action, inviting readers to embrace their curiosity, question the status quo, and actively participate in shaping a future where innovation and sustainability go hand in hand.




Solaris Odyssey
MIDIFOX
Protein Farm
Mycelium Box
Training Armor


Acacia


5 Buddhist Tibetan Rites
